name: grahamcrackerbox
title: New Music
description: New releases and reissues that you need to check out

items.description: Excellent eighth set from the U.K. alt-rock stalwarts that merges pain and paranoia with impeccable production. (from allmusic.com)
Smart punk with pop and indie rock overtones from members of Rocket from the Crypt, Pinback, and Against Me! (from allmusic.com)

Brooklyn's Rex made an incredible leap forward from its lackluster first album to C, its second and best. Stretching out over 70 minutes, the album is a lush, almost lethargic showcase for singer/guitarist Curtis Harvey's sad songs. Front-loaded with the band's best songs (the stunning Morning and Ride Home) and brimming over with tasteful string arrangements, C seems to be the record Rex had been trying to make since its inception. Hypnotic and repetitive -- but engaging rather than boring because of it -- this grouping of songs would inspire slowcore imitators, but wouldn't be matched. (from allmusic.com)
